articles.headline: ‘Unbelievable Turmoil’: Trump’s First Month Leaves Washington Reeling
articles.snippet: The resignation of Michael T. Flynn as national security adviser amid the tumultuous early days of Mr. Trump’s presidency has deeply rattled the Washington establishment.
articles.abstract: The resignation of Michael T. Flynn as national security adviser amid the tumultuous early days of Mr. Trump’s presidency has deeply rattled the Washington establishment.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The resignation of Michael T. Flynn as national security adviser caps a remarkably tumultuous first month for President Trump’s White House that has burdened the early days of his presidency with scandal, legal challenges, personnel drama and questions about his temperament during interactions with world leaders.

articles.headline: Flynn’s Downfall Sprang From ‘Eroding Level of Trust’
articles.snippet: Michael T. Flynn’s resignation as national security adviser raises questions about what President Trump knew about the situation, and when.
articles.abstract: Michael T. Flynn’s resignation as national security adviser raises questions about what President Trump knew about the situation, and when.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just days into his new position as President Trump’s national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn found himself in a meeting that any White House official would dread. Face to face with F.B.I. agents, he was grilled about a phone call he had had with Russia’s ambassador.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Glenn Thrush, Maggie Haberman, Adam Goldman and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: SoftBank of Japan Will Buy U.S. Private Equity Giant Fortress
articles.snippet: The surprising acquisition of Fortress Investment Group highlights the immense ambitions of SoftBank’s brash founder, Masayoshi Son.
articles.abstract: The surprising acquisition of Fortress Investment Group highlights the immense ambitions of SoftBank’s brash founder, Masayoshi Son.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over its three-decade existence, the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and its founder, Masayoshi Son, have been known for ambitious and sometimes head-scratching moves.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: A Victory for Trump Is a Victory for Big-Name Traders
articles.snippet: A quarterly ritual for fund managers shows investment managers placing bullish wagers on banks, manufacturers and construction stocks on hopes for growth.
articles.abstract: A quarterly ritual for fund managers shows investment managers placing bullish wagers on banks, manufacturers and construction stocks on hopes for growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn is one of several billionaire investors who have bet big on a Donald J. Trump presidency.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Trump Campaign Aides Had Repeated Contacts With Russian Intelligence
articles.snippet: The contacts in the year before the election were revealed by intercepted communications, according to four current and former senior American officials.
articles.abstract: The contacts in the year before the election were revealed by intercepted communications, according to four current and former senior American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Phone records and intercepted calls show that members of Donald J. Trump’s 2016 presidential campaign and other Trump associates had repeated contacts with senior Russian intelligence officials in the year before the election, according to four current and former American officials.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt, Mark Mazzetti and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: Intel Drops Its Sponsorship of Science Fairs, Prompting an Identity Crisis
articles.snippet: The chip giant is ending its support of the fairs and sponsoring newer events like homemade engineering contests. Critics say the traditional fairs are as vital as ever.
articles.abstract: The chip giant is ending its support of the fairs and sponsoring newer events like homemade engineering contests. Critics say the traditional fairs are as vital as ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: The science fair has been an annual rite of education for generations of students, going back to the 1940s. But even the term “science fair” stirs stereotypical images of three-panel display boards and baking-soda volcanoes. Its regimented routines can seem stodgy at a time when young people are flocking to more freewheeling forums for scientific creativity, like software hackathons and hardware engineering Maker Faires.

articles.headline: 20th Century Fox Used Fake News to Publicize ‘A Cure for Wellness’
articles.snippet: Many users thought articles on sites resembling city newspapers’ or HealthCare.gov were real exposés or scoops, like “Trump and Putin Spotted at Swiss Resort.”
articles.abstract: Many users thought articles on sites resembling city newspapers’ or HealthCare.gov were real exposés or scoops, like “Trump and Putin Spotted at Swiss Resort.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Making the most of the fractured political and media landscape, 20th Century Fox created a group of fake news sites as part of a viral marketing campaign for its new film “A Cure for Wellness.” The sites displayed ads for the movie and slipped references to its plot alongside made-up stories about divisive topics like abortion, vaccines and President Trump.

articles.headline: White House Proposes New Rules to Steady Insurance Markets Under Health Law
articles.snippet: As the Trump administration works to repeal the Affordable Care Act, it is moving to prevent a collapse of the public marketplaces in 2018.
articles.abstract: As the Trump administration works to repeal the Affordable Care Act, it is moving to prevent a collapse of the public marketplaces in 2018.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration proposed new rules on Wednesday to stabilize health insurance markets roiled by efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act, by big increases in premiums and by the exodus of major insurers.
